positive.review:
I‚Äôve spent endless hours recreating my real-life homes and even designing my dream sports agency office. The level of detail and freedom makes every project feel personal, and it‚Äôs incredibly satisfying to see my vision come to life.
What really takes it to the next level is the Steam Workshop integration. Pairing the base game with community mods opens up a whole new world of possibilities  from custom furniture and d√©cor to unique layouts and design inspirations. I like to think of it as my ikea lol If you are a creative person you can create and recreate so many different designs. One of my favorite games by far. I highly recommend this games especially if you love shows like on HGTV.

great game, love that there is freedom to to what you want in some of the tasks but also that you can use the money you earn to buy a house and do what ever you want then can keep or auction it off. GREAT FUN GAME AS A WHOLE BUT EVEN BETTER WITH dlc'S, The bunker DLC is also really good with the flame thrower being very efficient and fun to use.
great game, you can own as many dogs, cats and farm animals you want.
put on some music in the background and play this when you are bored. awesome game
Great game, so much fun and can spend endless hours playing!

Still one of my favourite games to come back to, even with the release of the 2nd game. They both have this sort of charm to them that develops after having so much passion and time poured into them. House Flipper is genuinely so fun to revisit time and time again with fresh ideas. I feel as if I always find different opportunities for fulfilling client requests and new ways to fit everything possibly needed into even the smallest building, without compromising on aesthetics. It's always a good, relaxing time.

I always enjoy a game where you clean and refurbish things. House Flipper is no exception. You clean houses, then can decorate them however the heck ya want with almost infinite creative freedom. Even without the DLC, there's so much to do it isn't even funny, though the Garden DLC is a must-have if you don't wanna take a flamethrower to your poor, poor lawn...
Very engaging the mechanics are amazing, the game overall is perfect for the people that like this kind of stuff.

House Flipper is a good game for those who like relaxing gameplay and passion projects. You can either buy and fix your own house or take on calls and fix someone else's house. You can also buy, fix, and sell houses.

Would kill for this game to be multiplayer

Wait they made a sequel and it is?

Go play that one instead i guess...
Enjoyed it till the end, not all DLC were worth getting. I strongly recomend getting garden extension for extra capabilities and garden items.
Amazing game, hits all my creative itches. Each DLC is worth it, loads of content, I really enjoyed the luxury DLC.
Had a lot of fun with this game! Though I did eventually have a falling off after finishing the career mode, so watch out...
Highly enjoyable and perfect for those who want to have a cleaning simulator while also flipping a house. The dlc really give it that replayability and expands on the base game greatly.
I loved the first one and definitly not disappointed with HF2. It has everything you could want in a game like this.

this game is literally my comfort game, its just so awesome sauce and fun. you can also buy like models from the steam marketplace to add some pizzazz to your builds. i would so so so recommend this :)
eu amo esse jogo, pois da pra me sentir arquiteta e explorar muitos gostos de cliente

I bet this game is very popular among autistic people
My wife and I love it
Don't buy House Flipper 2 tho, it sucks
very relaxing game, the way you clean the house from trash to new is so satisfying

Really good game to pass the time. Simple game mechanics that are easy to follow, easy to get money to buy the bigger houses and a really good mix of a cleaning and house decorating/building. I got this on sale over the summer with the survival and cyberpunk DLC and I much prefer the cyberpunk one if you're looking to get some extra content.
A calming game that you can take at your own pace. You are free to do whatever jobs you want when you want.

This game is very appealing as a relaxing game with no stressful time limits. The very beginning can be a bit painful without upgrades, but the upgrades come quickly and after 4-5 jobs you can start to just sit and enjoy the actual game play loop. If you really enjoy the house building and designing in games like the sims you may be interested in this game. I would recommend buying this version over House Flipper 2 as personally I prefer the mechanics and style of this game over the sequel.

I started playing this a few years back.  Then I got interrupted and side tracked by some other games and never got back to it.  I never meant to go this long!  So I restarted it earlier this week and had to relearn a few things.  I mostly love it.  I find it oddly relaxing.  More so once you upgrade enough that my hands and wrists don't get sore when I play.  (I'm getting old).  On the whole, the game is really enjoyable.  A few things could be better.  But completely worth playing.
I remember playing this game on mobile years ago! its even more fun on my laptop :D very relaxing if you like cleaning and renovating, definitely give this game a try!
This game is so easy that I kinda go brain dead playing it lol. This game is like Minecraft for me, I can spend hours and hours and never get tired of it. I 100% recommend for sure.
42 hours on record. Completed the free dlc and main game. Really looking forward to the remaster and getting more DLCs as and when I can as I thoroughly enjoyed the game so far!

This is a definite cozy, grinding game where you can just zone out to simple painting and mopping. I really enjoy the sounds and music and so grateful that you can toggle the bugs off to look like glass instead. 

I'm visually impaired and the ability to make things bigger is very nice but perhaps it could use some more zooming for the UI. With some zoom features I already have it's not impossible to read though. A 'dark mode' option would be ideal on the tablet and laptop.

I even got a friend to play this game and we've been having fun as of today but hopefuly more in the future. ^_^ Thank you so much!

House Flipper 1 continues to stand out as an incredibly rich and complete home-renovation experience. It offers a wide variety of houses to flip, an impressive selection of furniture and style options, and a huge amount of DLC content that keeps the game fresh and exciting for countless hours. One of my favorite parts of the game is the gardening system‚Äîthere are so many plants, tools, and customization options that designing outdoor spaces becomes just as enjoyable and rewarding as decorating the interiors.

The mechanics in the original game also feel wonderfully smooth and intuitive. The rooming system, in particular, is a standout feature. Being able to create and define individual rooms gives you total creative control and makes every renovation project feel unique and personal.

While House Flipper 2 introduces different features, House Flipper 1 remains my go-to because of how polished, content-rich, and satisfying the overall experience is. If you‚Äôre looking for a fully developed home-renovation game with tons of creative freedom, House Flipper 1 is absolutely worth recommending.

Came back to House Flipper after completing it on the Console Version, tried out the Apocalypse DLC finally and decided to rant on what would appear to be an AR-15 or an AR-15 with some M4A1 parts. Overall a good game if you have a weird need to flip a house.
great game, I absolutely had to buy it, wish I could buy everything that these people make lol

I absolutely love this game I have played the base game on Xbox and have bought the game and all the DLC when it was on sale a great buy I think now to wait for House Flipper 2 and all its DLC to go on sale...
I like that this game is a nice, zone-out-and-play game. I like living out my house-flipping dreams on this
One of the best simulators games ever i suggest people to try it out
This game is absolutely amazing. Always a great time killer and just a nice little game to play when you're looking to have some creative stims!
Soothing. Good game for listening to video essays and podcasts while decompressing. Helped me get through my mom stealing 11.3k and giving me the debt.
Fun game, something to focus on. Not your game if you need a lot of stimulation, but I love playing it while listening to music or watching TV,

I don't understand games like this. There's no rocket launcher and no Arch Viles to blow up. That being said, if you like cleaning and redecorating there's probably a lot of fun stuff in here. But your starting office comes with a chainsaw and it's first-person, so if you squint really hard it could be Doom...?

This game is stupid addictive lol I enjoy my relaxing games that I can chill out and play while getting baked at the end of the day and this has been my favorite for the last 30 hours. There's a lot you can do but it's very simple at the same time. *One complaint* It was giving me a save authorization error that took me a few nights to figure out how to fix. I ended up needing to redirect from onedrive and create another folder in appdata. But either way, after it was fixed everything's been fine since then and I LOVE this game

This is a very soothing game.  It's fun without any kind of timed-adreneline-rush aspect; the music is calm-- like elevator music, but not cheesy-- and I can easily lose track of time for an afternoon while playing.  When it's time to save and walk away, there's peace in knowing that the next time I want to come back to it there's basically no entry curve.
If you like casual and relaxing game, this game can be for you. Easy to play, fun, a lot of tasks. I wish it has multiplayer choice so I can work on the house projects with friends.
Super fun game, wish it had more side jobs to do but other wise really simple n fun game.

I have put 30+ hours into this game on the steamdeck and I really enjoy it. I love how you can buy houses and decorate them how you want to. I will say it gets a bit repetitive, and a lot of the houses are the same layout. Another one of my favorite things to do is clean the windows, is very satisfying. 4.8/5 stars.

One of my all time favorite games.
I wish i could do this job irl but im sadly too uncreative :,) 
this is my cope

A good game for when you want your brain to shut off. Love playing this at 3am after a good shooter session, helps me chill out. Also if you're a fan of achievement farming, doing just about anything gives you an achievement.
Mega chill game, nothing special but not anything bad.

English:
House Flipper is a great chill game, perfect for relaxing. However, the core gameplay is very repetitive. The developers also have a "Paradox-style" DLC policy, selling DLCs that cost about 4x the price of the base game, which I absolutely do not recommend. The repetitive nature of the game just doesn't justify that massive extra cost. That said, if you can find the base game for under $5, it's worth picking up just to try.

Ayrƒ±ca tam bir "Paradox kafasƒ±" ile yapƒ±lmƒ±≈ü, oyun fiyatƒ±nƒ±n 4 katƒ±na DLC satƒ±yorlar; bu y√ºzden DLC'leri kesinlikle √∂nermem. I needed a game that I could play 1. While listening to an audiobook 2. With a controller.
This game has fufilled my needs greatly. I even bought all the DLCs because im playing this nonstop

House Flipper is one of those games that‚Äôs perfect for when you just want to unwind and lose track of time. There‚Äôs something incredibly satisfying about transforming run-down spaces into cozy, livable homes, one paint stroke and floor tile at a time. It‚Äôs equal parts creative outlet and stress relief ‚Äî the kind of game you can play while sipping tea and letting your mind drift.

While I‚Äôve noticed that the painting and tiling mechanics feel smoother and a bit more intuitive in House Flipper 2, the original still holds its charm. It‚Äôs simple, peaceful, and surprisingly immersive, especially once you get into a rhythm of cleaning, fixing, and redecorating. Whether you‚Äôre testing your interior design instincts or just looking for a way to relax after a long day, House Flipper delivers a cozy, creative escape that‚Äôs hard to beat.
Love this game, I love to clean and organize without having to leave my chair.

This game is like pure serotonin to my brain. Gives the comforting hug and satisfaction of stable housing despite the ever collapsing world around us. Major love to the devs for including the creepies and crawlies in the Pets DLC <3
This is a fun little time killer which allows you to redirect your real stress into game stress.
A nice relaxing game about cleaning and Over-hauling people's houses and shi. It's the only game out of all my games that my girlfriend plays when she comes over!

Very fun for people who like job simulators or who like renovation games, house flipper 2 is essentially the same game as this so get whichever one you want. For my achievement hunters like me however this one is gonna be really annoying, most of the achievements come from the dlc's which do go on sale fairly often but some are still as expensive as another game when on sale so take that with a grain of salt.
I love giving everything I can the landlord special and then selling it for the highest possible price, really feels accurate to real life. 10/10 would scam again
u would like to play this game if u want to be of the following eletrician engineer contractor or just play for funüòÄ
It's a calming game. Lots of fun designing what the houses look like.
Strangely relaxing and addictive. Turning a filthy wreck into a cozy home never gets old.
Perfect and relaxing game! Good game to put on some music and relax while playing it

Great game and even greater mods on the steam workshop
If you like home design and losing count of the hours passing, then this is the game for you
Good game to chill out on and just zone out. Painting, tiling and interior decorating galore.
good game fun relaxing a bit. the controls are a little off putting but exceeded my expectations by a mile. the dlcs also are good.

Man is this game so soothing to me. I didn't expect to like it as much as I have. I definitely recommend getting it on sale. 10/10 for calming down my anxiety and being a very low brain energy game. I also appreciate the now economically far fetched dream of home-ownership.

I've gotten caught up in playing this game for 5 or 6 hours at a time and it's still hard to turn off at 1am.  I have 27 hours played and I just started 4 or 5 days ago.  The one negative is that you have to buy the DLC to get mowing. A lot of the yards have knee-high grass when you buy them.  How does a house flipping game not have the option to mow the yard from day 1?  At worst it should have been added in a patch.
house flipper is amazing by its self but if you can try to get the mods for it!
its nowhere near as tedious as power washing sim and i appreciate that. i also like buying more houses
Bought a house, cleaned it, destroyed it, fixed it again‚Ä¶ basically a normal day in my life. Very satisfying chaos...
It's great for organizing, building, cleaning and you can put them how you want them to be put, and the more you unlock the more you can upgrade your "office" and get it sold to people
For people with OCD and ADHD, OMG so good, so addictive, so satisfying!

Nice, relaxing, but will take away your social life the second you start playing! Your entire world will revolve around flipping houses and you'll end up sitting in the bathroom thinking: "I want to redesign you in house flipper"
My eyeballs hurt after i see the mess yet i still clean that shit up and after that i rub my balls on their sofa
Runs surprisingly well on my potato computer
I really enjoy this game and my new addiction! It was recommended by my mom and I'm glad I was able to get it during a big sale, which also came with 2 of DLC.
it's a good game, can be fun every once in a while when bored, missing co-op tho
So much fun! I've loved house planning for a long time, and I've wanted to plan my own, but no software or apps I could find would let me get it quite right, but with this, I can do so much more!
Being able to get lost in this game for an endless amount of time has been splendid.
really satisfying and good for passing time
I've only been playing for awhile now but I love this game . I'm having a lot of fun with it.
Very fun. Some of the controls are odd but I enjoy the game!
I like the different things you can do and its not always the same
It's a fun house game and i swear. ITS THE ONLY GOOD HOUSE CHANGING ONE I'VE FOUND
Utterly tedious, but there's a time and place for that
Thought ts would be boring but I get to spend my hours repeatedly remodeling a kitchen
DONT PAINT, MY HANDS AHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!! also this crap is peak
Very addictive and satisfying!
I can't stop playing it i will wake up and then turn it on and play til I go to bed
Has a few small issues but very fun overall.

Nobody reads my reviews anyway.
I'll throw in a recipe for Varenyky.

Recipe for Potato Dumplings (Varenyky)
Ingredients:
For the dough:
Wheat flour ‚Äì 500 g
Water ‚Äì 200 ml
Egg ‚Äì 1
Salt ‚Äì 1 tsp
For the filling:
Potatoes ‚Äì 1 kg
Onions ‚Äì 2
Lard or butter ‚Äì 50 g
Salt ‚Äì to taste
Ground black pepper ‚Äì to taste
Preparation steps:
Making the dough:
Sifting the flour: Sift the flour into a large bowl.
Making the dough: Add salt and the egg to the flour. Gradually pour in the water, constantly stirring. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic.
Resting the dough: Wrap the dough in plastic wrap or cover it with a towel and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Preparing the filling:
Boiling the potatoes: Peel the potatoes, cut them into large pieces, and boil until tender in salted water.
Preparing the onions: While the potatoes are boiling, finely chop the onions. Saut√© the onions in lard or butter until golden brown.
Making the potato puree: Drain the potatoes and mash them. Add the saut√©ed onions, salt, and pepper to taste, and mix well.
Forming the dumplings:
Rolling out the dough: Roll out the dough into a thin sheet about 2-3 mm thick. Use a glass or cutter to cut out circles approximately 7-8 cm in diameter.
Forming the dumplings: Place a spoonful of potato filling on each circle of dough. Fold the dough in half and pinch the edges tightly to seal the dumplings.
Cooking the dumplings:
Boiling water: Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add salt.
Cooking the dumplings: Gently drop the dumplings into the boiling water, stirring carefully to prevent sticking. Cook until done (approximately 5-7 minutes after they float to the surface).
Serving:
Removing the dumplings: Remove the dumplings with a slotted spoon and place them on a plate.
Serving: Serve the dumplings hot, optionally drizzling with melted butter, sour cream, or saut√©ed onions.
Enjoy your meal!
Fun to play, have lost hours without realising
One of the most satisfying games I have played in a long time.
nice and relaxing game i love it
its a cool game and very creative!
Chill and mindless when you don't want to "think" during a game
a nice game to chill out, I recommend it.
very satisfying, and tedious.

good game look down for more

















good boy
This is the most fun game I've ever played! I highly recommend it!
its fun if you like bilding you have inf creatifate 8/10
I enjoy the whole restoration process.
It's fun to come up with a plan for each room.

negative.review:
I normally wait until I perfect games to review them, but I can't perfect it, and refuse to continue funding creators who lock achievements behind DLC, forcing someone to dish out money if they want to perfect this game.
Which is a shame because  the base game is fun, but locking achievements behind a paywall is scummy and I dont support any P2W features

I enjoy the decoration but something about the game just feels uncanny, I think it might be the graphics and odd quietness. The game is also way overpriced, for ¬£20.00 it's not worth it. Luckily I got it on sale for ¬£2.00. If you want a cosy game play something like Stardew Valley - much cheaper, and more content.

I do like this game, but how do ya'll STILL not patch the disappearing doors glitch after over 7 years? Constantly wasting in game money trying to install new front doors because of this glitch isn't worth it
Kind of fun, but the game fails to save progress and crashes a lot. It's better to just wait for the remastered version to come out.

i think i would have loved this game if it wasn't on first person pov. i have labyrinthitis so playing games like this after one or two hours takes a toll on me... and this game specificly caused me to feel the worst i ever felt. that was the reason i uninstalled actually, and i do not intend on buying the second one or the dlcs. also the whole setting kinda adds to the problem?? idk

i honestly wish there was a setting specifically for this, for people who have this kind of issue... and i don't mean only on house flipper, i genuinely do not play a bunch of games i actually have interest in because of this issue...

anyway, recommend bc it's a cool game if cleaning and renovating is your thing, developing skills as you use them the more and more, there's room for creativity too so you can have a bit of free will on renovating people's houses. and, obviously, if we don't share the same condition. cause if we do, then just don't bother buying it lol i know i was stubborn when i did
The concept and the features are nice but the campain is too short and the buying and selling of the houses doesnt fell rewarding at all..
IT IS A BAD GAME NOT FUN AFTER 1 DAY BAD BAD BAD
Not Cool and good üëé
Trash game.
DLC simulator

I cannot believe this problem is still in the game after all these years. You fix an outlet, and suddenly you can‚Äôt replace the cabinets/furniture anymore. It completely breaks the flow of the renovation. The whole point of House Flipper is redesigning and improving spaces, yet this bug leaves you with furniture jutting out. 

This isn‚Äôt a small issue. It directly affects game play. The fact that it‚Äôs still not fixed makes it feel like the developers just don‚Äôt care about basic functionality.

I like the concept of House Flipper and I‚Äôve put a bunch of hours into it, but things like this ruin the experience. If the game wants to call itself a renovation simulator, then players should at least be able to replace furniture after doing electrical work.

Until that gets fixed, I can‚Äôt recommend it.

I've spend nearly $100 on this game, for the base game plus 6 DLC's and now they are coming out with the remastered game.  Gimme a break.  800 new items and 6 new jobs/houses and there are rumors that we will get a discount based off the amount of dlc's we own but seriously, why are we buying the game again, at all?  $100 and they switch and offer the exact game with some new additions that should've just been added to the original game.

House Flipper sounds fun on paper, but it gets boring very quickly. The first few houses are satisfying to renovate, but after a while it‚Äôs just the same tasks over and over ‚Äì clean, paint, place furniture ‚Äì with very little variety.

The game lacks depth and creativity once you‚Äôve seen all the tools and items. There‚Äôs not much challenge or progression, and it ends up feeling more like busywork than a simulator.

If you enjoy repetitive, relaxing tasks it might be for you, but for me it just got dull too fast.

the new remaster edition is kinda rubbing me the wrong way, instead of just updating this game to make the changes you are gonna make us buy another game, even if you do get a "discount on the game for the amount of DLC you own". Like i already bought the game period. Like you can think what you want but i will not be buying the remaster collection to get a few extras that you could have just added to this game. I understand that work goes into the game for the remaster but its already pretty expensive to buy all the dlc. If you give me a 10 dollar upgrade then sure no problem but i already know its gonna be more than that. The actual game good game highly recommend but i will not be spending more money for something i already own.

Not quite sure why these devs are releasing a "Remastered Collection" of a game that's been out for a whole seven years. Collection will give a "discount" depending on how many of the DLCs for the original you own, but with how many bugs and issues there have been in this one, why should your supporters need to pay for a second version of the same game- with some new graphics and items- if you can't even be bothered to fix this one? Not a big fan of that business practice. Just update the graphics and fix the bugs and add the new items to your original game- it's not even a decade old; a "Remastered Collection" is SUCH a scummy money grab and is completely unnecessary. Just eww.

Dear god, don't expect me to buy anymore of these. What a waste of time and money. I spent most of the time I have played so far trying to figure out how to fix an outlet. How stupid. Honestly, this game is stupid.

House Flipper is amusing at first, while you're getting to know the game and have a few jobs to do. The jobs pay out a lot better than renovating houses you buy and are less tedious, . You will soon complete all the jobs and be left with only buying houses to renovate. And by renovate they mean mostly decorate to someone else's taste. I didn't want an interior decorating game but that's ultimately what this is. There seem to be many DLCs that might make the game a little more interesting but I shouldn't have to buy DLC to tolerate a game.
The game is really monotonous and tedious..pulling weeds IRL is more exciting then doing that (or anything else) in the game.

I enjoy the decoration but something about the game just feels uncanny, I think it might be the graphics and odd quietness. The game is also way overpriced, for ¬£20.00 it's not worth it. Luckily I got it on sale for ¬£2.00. If you want a cosy game play something like Stardew Valley - much cheaper, and more content.

I do like this game, but how do ya'll STILL not patch the disappearing doors glitch after over 7 years? Constantly wasting in game money trying to install new front doors because of this glitch isn't worth it
Kind of fun, but the game fails to save progress and crashes a lot. It's better to just wait for the remastered version to come out.

i think i would have loved this game if it wasn't on first person pov. i have labyrinthitis so playing games like this after one or two hours takes a toll on me... and this game specificly caused me to feel the worst i ever felt. that was the reason i uninstalled actually, and i do not intend on buying the second one or the dlcs. also the whole setting kinda adds to the problem?? idk

i honestly wish there was a setting specifically for this, for people who have this kind of issue... and i don't mean only on house flipper, i genuinely do not play a bunch of games i actually have interest in because of this issue...

anyway, recommend bc it's a cool game if cleaning and renovating is your thing, developing skills as you use them the more and more, there's room for creativity too so you can have a bit of free will on renovating people's houses. and, obviously, if we don't share the same condition. cause if we do, then just don't bother buying it lol i know i was stubborn when i did
The concept and the features are nice but the campain is too short and the buying and selling of the houses doesnt fell rewarding at all..
I do not recommend anything other than the base game at this point. If you are looking for a casual game that has building but no fighting i recommend The Planet Crafter.
IT IS A BAD GAME NOT FUN AFTER 1 DAY BAD BAD BAD
i really enjoy flipping houses

The concept and the features are nice but the campain is too short and the buying and selling of the houses doesnt fell rewarding at all..

I enjoy the decoration but something about the game just feels uncanny, I think it might be the graphics and odd quietness. The game is also way overpriced, for ¬£20.00 it's not worth it. Luckily I got it on sale for ¬£2.00. If you want a cosy game play something like Stardew Valley - much cheaper, and more content.

I do like this game, but how do ya'll STILL not patch the disappearing doors glitch after over 7 years? Constantly wasting in game money trying to install new front doors because of this glitch isn't worth it

[first of all im not from usa so my currency and dlcs cost will be different] Okay, first of all, the game itself is alright if you enjoy decorating and cleaning which I do. But are the developers worth supporting? FUCH NAH. As someone who likes completing games, this one is a hard pass.

Each DLC costing around 55.95 is wild, and the base game is almost 100 by itself. I understand wanting DLC buyers to feel like they‚Äôre getting something valuable, but every time you try to finish the game, they keep adding more and more DLCs. It ruins the fun. On top of that, some of the DLCs aren‚Äôt even worth it.

Asking players to spend this much money is just greedy. There‚Äôs nearly 600 worth of DLC, and a lot of it doesn‚Äôt even look worth buying. Even during sales, the prices barely drop maybe down to 44 or 35 if you‚Äôre lucky. The cheaper DLCs are boring, but still required if you want full completion. And bundles don‚Äôt help much either.

I completed House Flipper 2, and of course they immediately started releasing [DLC]'s for that as well. Now, to complete it again, you need a DLC that costs around 50. How the achievement count jumped from 36 to 48, I honestly don‚Äôt know, but some companies really are greedy.

If you don‚Äôt like games that basically make you pay for achievements, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend buying anything from this company unless you have money to spare for devs who seem hungry for every bit they can get.
IT IS A BAD GAME NOT FUN AFTER 1 DAY BAD BAD BAD
Not Cool and good üëé
Trash game.
DLC simulator

I've spend nearly $100 on this game, for the base game plus 6 DLC's and now they are coming out with the remastered game.  Gimme a break.  800 new items and 6 new jobs/houses and there are rumors that we will get a discount based off the amount of dlc's we own but seriously, why are we buying the game again, at all?  $100 and they switch and offer the exact game with some new additions that should've just been added to the original game.

House Flipper sounds fun on paper, but it gets boring very quickly. The first few houses are satisfying to renovate, but after a while it‚Äôs just the same tasks over and over ‚Äì clean, paint, place furniture ‚Äì with very little variety.

The game lacks depth and creativity once you‚Äôve seen all the tools and items. There‚Äôs not much challenge or progression, and it ends up feeling more like busywork than a simulator.

If you enjoy repetitive, relaxing tasks it might be for you, but for me it just got dull too fast.

the new remaster edition is kinda rubbing me the wrong way, instead of just updating this game to make the changes you are gonna make us buy another game, even if you do get a "discount on the game for the amount of DLC you own". Like i already bought the game period. Like you can think what you want but i will not be buying the remaster collection to get a few extras that you could have just added to this game. I understand that work goes into the game for the remaster but its already pretty expensive to buy all the dlc. If you give me a 10 dollar upgrade then sure no problem but i already know its gonna be more than that. The actual game good game highly recommend but i will not be spending more money for something i already own.

I normally wait until I perfect games to review them, but I can't perfect it, and refuse to continue funding creators who lock achievements behind DLC, forcing someone to dish out money if they want to perfect this game.
Which is a shame because  the base game is fun, but locking achievements behind a paywall is scummy and I dont support any P2W features

Not quite sure why these devs are releasing a "Remastered Collection" of a game that's been out for a whole seven years. Collection will give a "discount" depending on how many of the DLCs for the original you own, but with how many bugs and issues there have been in this one, why should your supporters need to pay for a second version of the same game- with some new graphics and items- if you can't even be bothered to fix this one? Not a big fan of that business practice. Just update the graphics and fix the bugs and add the new items to your original game- it's not even a decade old; a "Remastered Collection" is SUCH a scummy money grab and is completely unnecessary. Just eww.

Dear god, don't expect me to buy anymore of these. What a waste of time and money. I spent most of the time I have played so far trying to figure out how to fix an outlet. How stupid. Honestly, this game is stupid.

House Flipper is amusing at first, while you're getting to know the game and have a few jobs to do. The jobs pay out a lot better than renovating houses you buy and are less tedious, . You will soon complete all the jobs and be left with only buying houses to renovate. And by renovate they mean mostly decorate to someone else's taste. I didn't want an interior decorating game but that's ultimately what this is. There seem to be many DLCs that might make the game a little more interesting but I shouldn't have to buy DLC to tolerate a game.
